intro: Dimeria kalavoorensis, commonly known as the Kalavoor dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in the spring. The plant has hairy, woody stems and produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
